thread.title: ATA Honors Trucking's Champions

author: cbs8
title: ATA Honors Trucking's Champions
text:
American Trucking Associations
Winners of Federation's Top Awards and Competitions Recognized at Annual MCE
PHILADELPHIA , Oct. 18, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Today, American Trucking Associations recognized the winners of some of the industry's top honors as part of the annual Management Conference & Exhibition.
"Throughout the country, the trucking industry is full of individuals who exhibit a commitment to safety and professionalism each day, but there are certain individuals who have surpassed the call of duty in demonstrating that commitment," said ATA President and CEO Bill Graves .
Winners of the National Truck Driving Championships and TMCSuperTech National Technician Skills Competition were honored during the ATA Management Conference & Exhibition.
ATA recognized Ronald Emenheiser , a Walmart Transportation professional truck driver based in Yorkana, Pennsylvania , and 2015 Bendix National Truck Driving Championships Grand Champion, as well as Eric Vos , a technician with FedEx Freight, Boise, Idaho , 2015 Technology and Maintenance Council SuperTech Grand Champion. Emenheiser has been a professional truck driver for more than 25 years and this year was his second appearance at the National Truck Driving Championships. Vos has 11 years of experience with FedEx Freight and earned second-place finishes at SuperTech in 2010, 2013 and 2014.
Both events were held earlier this year and a full list of division winners is below.
The ATA National Truck Driver of the Year was also announced today. This year, the award goes to James Hylan Grise , a Walmart Transportation driver from Lewisburg, Kentucky . Grise has been a professional truck driver for over 42 years and accumulated more than 4 million accident-free miles. He also appeared at the National Truck Driving Championships in 2005, 2011 and 2012.
Three fleets were honored with the ATA President's Award. Kenco Transportation Services, PITT OHIO and Roehl Transport Inc. were selected for the Under 25 Million Miles, 25-100 Million Miles, and the Over 100 Million Miles awards respectively because of their impressive commitment to safety and proven safety results. The ATA President's Award goes to fleets who demonstrate innovative approaches to safety and go above and beyond to keep America's highways safe.
ATA will be announcing its National Safety Director of the Year and National Safety Professional Award of Excellence winners at the Safety & Human Resources National Conference & Exhibition November 2-4 in Little Rock, Ark.
President's Award Winners
Under 25 Million Miles : Kenco Transportation Services
25 â€“ 100 Million Miles : PITT OHIO
Over 100 Million Miles: Roehl Transport Inc.

American Trucking Associations is the largest national trade association for the trucking industry. Through a federation of 50 affiliated state trucking associations and industry-related conferences and councils, ATA is the voice of the industry America depends on most to move our nation's freight. Follow ATA on Twitter or on Facebook . Trucking Moves America Forward
